item.description:
Dear Film Enthusiasts,

Please join us on Friday, February 3, 2012 at 7pm in the Samuel B. Webb Elementary School auditorium (51 Willow Street, Wethersfield) for the 4th screening in our 2011-2012 Italian Film Series.  

L’Avventura, 1960, was directed by Michelangelo Antonioni. The film stars Monica Vitti as Anna, a wealthy woman whose friend disappears during a Mediterranean boating trip. The investigation surrounding the missing woman’s whereabouts evolves into a search for love and the meaning of life. L’Avventura is considered by many to be a milestone in the history of cinema; Antonioni’s visual masterpiece explores existentialism and is one of the finest examples of an art-house film.

 

 

We will begin the evening with an introduction of the film. After screening the film attendees are welcome to participate in an exchange of ideas and observations. We look forward to seeing you on Friday, February 3rd at 7pm.

 

Thank you,

Diana Reeve

 

EVENT: Italian Film Series

SCREENING: L’Avventura, 1960 (B&W, Italian with English subtitles)

EVENT DATE: Friday, February 3, 2012

**EVENT LOCATION: Samuel B. Webb Elementary School auditorium - 51 Willow Street, Wethersfield, CT 06109 

EVENT TIME: 7pm

COST: FREE AND OPEN TO THE PUBLIC

EVENT SPONSORED BY: The Wethersfield High School Italian National Honor Society in cooperation with the Italian Culture Center of Education and the Wethersfield Chapter of UNICO
